metadata.title: CVE-2024-24856 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description: The memory allocation function ACPI_ALLOCATE_ZEROED does not guarantee asuccessful allocation, but the subsequent code directly dereferences thepointer that receives it, which may lead to null pointer dereference. Tofix this issue, a null pointer check should be added. If it is null, returnexception code AE_NO_MEMORY.

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
